page.title: 01Strathmiglo and its environs
page.content: Strathmiglo is a small village with a population of just over 900, situated in the north west of Fife, in the valley of the River Eden. Formerly the Eden was known as the Miglo at this point, hence, Strathmiglo - valley of the Miglo.The Eden divides the village into roughly two halves. The High Street,the main business street,with its Town Hall (1734), is on the north side and roughly parallel on the south side is Cash Feus and a continuation known as Skene Street. The land rises gently to the north and south of the village towards the Ochil and Lomond Hills. Most of the land is rich farmland, the most important crops being wheat and barley. Much of the underlying rock formation is red sandstone, which in the past was quarried and used for many local buildings.
